turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Just don't give up on Maya. Cool smart chicks like that --they like persistence.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I don't want to talk about it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: All I know is she's beautiful. Lots of soul. Perfect for you. I'm not going to feel good about this trip until you guys hook up. Don't you just want to feel that cozy little box grip down on your Johnson?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Is it the money thing?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Is what the money thing?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: With Maya.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Well, yeah, that's part of it. Woman finds out how I live, that I'm not a published author, that I'm a liar essentially, then yeah, any interest is gonna evaporate real quick. If you don't have money at my age, you're not even in the game. You're just a pasture animal waiting for the abattoir.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Is an abattoir like a... like a... what is that?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Slaughterhouse.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Abattoir. Huh. But you are going to get the good news this week about your book. I know you are. I can feel it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We're on.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What's happening?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We're going to have some fun. Remember fun? We're going to have some of it. Okay?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What exactly are we going to do?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I said okay?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You have to tell me --

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I SAID OKAY?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You ever actually read any of this guy's books?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: He wrote a great one on Burgundy, and I used to get his newsletter, but then there were doubts about whether he does all his own tasting. Plus a couple of times he declared certain years vintages of the century, and they turned out to be turkeys. Fucker never retracted.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Huh.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yo! Yo! Here's my boy! Here's my boy! Who's your daddy, boy? Who is yo' daddy?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Put me down, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So tell me everything. Details. I like details.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: It's private.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're kidding, right? Tell me what happened, you fucker, or I'll tie your dick in a knot.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Let's leave it alone.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You didn't get any, did you?  You're a homo.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Just stop, okay? Make something up, and that's what happened. Whatever you want. Write my confession, and I'll sign it. Just stop pushing me all the time! I can't take it! You're an infant! This is all a big party for you, but not for me! This is serious. And you -- Just... leave me alone, okay? You're fucking me up.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Wow. Okay. Calm down. Sorry.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Did you have trouble performing? Yeah, that's...

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Shut up! Shut up, Jack!

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: This whole week has gone sour. It isn't turning out like it was supposed to.  I want to go home.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Who's being selfish now? I'm the one getting married. I thought this week was supposed to be about me.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: We gotta slow down.  I'm so tired. Let's just get out of here.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I know what you need.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Do you like them?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah, they're great. Sporty. They're really sporty.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Are they too sporty?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How about this one? We didn't hit this one.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yeah, it's Frass Canyon. It's a joke.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You ever actually been in there, Miles?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I don't have to.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I say we check it out. You never know.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Tastes like the back of a fucking LA schoolbus. Probably didn't de-stem, hoping for some semblance of concentration, crushed it up with leaves and mice, wound up with this rancid tar and turpentine mouthwash bullshit. Fucking Raid.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't know. Tastes okay to me.  Hey, they got a reserve pinot.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Let me use your phone.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What's up?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I can't take it anymore. I've got to call Evelyn.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Just write another one. You have lots of ideas, right?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: No, I'm finished. I'm not a writer. I'm a middle-school English teacher. I'm going to spend the rest of my life grading essays and reading the works of others. It's okay. I like books. The world doesn't give a shit what I have to say. I'm unnecessary.  I'm so insignificant, I can't even kill myself.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What's that supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You know -- Hemingway, Sexton, Woolf, Plath, Delmore Schwartz. You can't kill yourself before you've even been published.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What about that guy who wrote Confederacy of Dunces? He committed suicide before he got published, and look how famous he is.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't give up. You're going to make it.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Half my life is over, and I have nothing to show for it. I'm a thumbprint on the window of a skyscraper. I'm a smudge of excrement on a tissue surging out to sea with a million tons of raw sewage.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: See? Right there. Just what you just said. That's beautiful. A thumbprint on a skyscraper. I couldn't write that.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Neither could I. I think it's Bukowski.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Aren't you glad you didn't move up here and marry her?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't need a lecture. You fucking told Maya, didn't you?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: No, I did not. Must have been Gary at the Hitching Post. I think we mentioned it to him the first night.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You told him. I'm fucking hurting here.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Keep it elevated.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm going to need an operation. Maybe a couple of them. They have to wait for it it to heal first. Then they break it again.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Good thing you have a voice-over career.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Gonna fuck that up too. I should sue her ass. Only reason I won't is to protect Christine.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: That's thoughtful.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So how did Stephanie know it was Saturday? We didn't get into that with Gary.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Huh. Let me think.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You sure you didn't say anything to Maya?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Sure I'm sure. And just what are you implying? I'm really pissed off at you about all this, if you want to know the truth. What's Maya going to think of me now just for associating with you? You're the one who's sabotaging me, not the other way around, pal. Not by a longshot.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What's it look like to you?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Looks like you were in a bad car accident.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You know what I'm thinking?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm thinking it's time to settle down. One woman. One house. You know. It's time.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I bet you that chick is two tons of fun. You know, the grateful type.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I don't know. I wouldn't know.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She gets off in an hour, so I think I'm just going to have a drink and then... make sure she gets home safe.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You're joking, right?  What are you doing? Un-fucking- believeable. Can we just go back to the hotel and hang out and get up early and play nine holes before we head home?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Fucking chick's married.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Her husband works a night shift or something, and he comes home, and I'm on the floor with my cock in his wife's ass.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Jesus, Jack. Jesus. And you walked all the way back from Solvang?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Ran. Twisted my ankle too.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: That's five clicks, Jackson.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Fucking-a it's five clicks! At one point I had to cut through an ostrich farm. Fuckers are mean.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We gotta go back.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I left my wallet. My credit cards, cash, fucking ID, everything. We gotta go back.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Big deal. We'll call right now and cancel your cards.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You don't understand. The wedding bands. The wedding bands are in my wallet.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Okay, so they were in your wallet, and you left your wallet somewhere. Some bar. Christine'll understand.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No. She ordered them special. Took her forever to find them. They've got this design on them with dolphins and our names engraved in Sanskrit. We've got to go back. Christine'll fucking crucify me.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: No way. No way.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Please, Miles, please.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Forget it. Your wallet was stolen at a bar. Happens every day.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: She tell you she was married?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: So what the fuck were you thinking?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Wasn't supposed to be back till six. Fucker rolls in at five.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Cutting it a little close, don't you think?  So how was she? Compared to Stephanie, say.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Horny as shit. Flopping around like a landed trout.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: So what's the plan?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The plan is... you go.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: My ankle. Just go explain the situation.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Uh, excuse me, sir, but my friend was the one balling your wife a couple hours ago, and he seems to have left his wallet behind, and we were wondering...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah, yeah. Like that. Just like that.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Fuck you. I'll get it myself.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Hold on.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Hey, Jack. Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hrnrnrn?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: That was quite a day yesterday.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yep. Quite a day.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Quite a week.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Want me to drive?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: No, I'm okay.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hey, why don't you invite Maya to the wedding?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Somehow I don't think inviting Maya to your wedding is the right move. In fact, after your bullshit, it's going to be hard for me to even go to the Hitching Post again.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're so negative.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Come on, let me drive.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I'm fine. You rest.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I feel like driving.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Nothing. Buckle up, okay?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What the fuck!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You said it looked like a car accident.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What the fuck!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'll pay for it.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Look at this!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't know. Doesn't look like anybody got hurt in this one.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Oh, no. Oh, Christ. No, you don't.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You need a new car anyway.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You broke some.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Whatever. Sorry.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: No, not whatever. You fucking derelict.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Well. That about does it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why don't you come in?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Uh-uh. You're on your own.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So I'll see you at the rehearsal.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Love you, man.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Back at you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hey, don't pull away till they see the car.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yeah.  Hey, why wasn't I injured?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You were wearing your belt.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Hey, Miles. Good to see you.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Maya, how are you?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: I'm doing good, good. You look great. Did you lose some weight?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Oh, no, actually. Busy night.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Oh yeah, Sunday night. You guys been out tasting today?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You know it. This is my friend Jack. Jack, Maya.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You want to join us?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: So how's that book of yours going, Miles? I think you were almost done with it last time we talked.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I finished it.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Good for you.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Yeah, I know what you mean. It's a long drive up here. Where're you staying?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: The Windmill.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Well, good to see you, Miles. Jack.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: See you.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What are you drinking?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: A Fiddlehead Sauvignon Blanc.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Oh yeah? How is it?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Try it.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Nice. Very nice.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Twelve months in oak.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: On a Sauvignon Blanc?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: I know the winemaker. She comes in the restaurant all the time.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: This is good. Little hints of clove.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: I know. I love that.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: I'm having the salmon.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: That's what I'm having.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Are you all right?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Fine. Just slipped.  This is my blood.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: She got anything good?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Oh, yeah. Steph's way into Pinots and Syrahs.  Hey, Steph? You sure we can open anything? Anything we want?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: So what gems do you have in your collection?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Not much of a collection really. I haven't had the wallet for that, so I sort of live bottle to bottle. But I've got a couple things I'm saving. I guess the star would be a 1961 Cheval Blanc.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: You've got a '61 Cheval Blanc that's just sitting there? Go get it.  Right now. Hurry up...

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Seriously, the '61s are peaking, aren't they? At least that's what I've read.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yeah, I know.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: It might be too late already. What are you waiting for?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I don't know. Special occasion. With the right person. It was supposed to be for my tenth wedding anniversary.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: The day you open a '61 Cheval Blanc, that's the special occasion.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: How long have you been into wine?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: I started to get serious about seven years ago.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What was the bottle that did it?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Eighty-eight Sassicaia.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Wow. We gotta give it a moment, but this is tasty. Really good. How about you?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: I think they overdid it a bit. Too much alcohol. Overwhelms the fruit.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yeah, I'd say you're right on the money.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Is this Stephanie's kid? Sure is cute.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Yeah, Siena's a sweetie.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Is she sleeping or...?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: She's with her grandmother. She's with Steph's mom. She spends a lot of time over there. Steph's... well, she's Stephanie.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: You got kids?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Who me? Nah, I'd just fuck them up. That was the one unpolluted part of my divorce -- no kids.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Yeah, same here.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: It's kind of weird sitting here with you in Stephanie's house. All those times you came into the restaurant. It's like you're a real person now. Almost.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yeah, I know. It's kind of weird. Out of context.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Yeah, weird. But great.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yeah. Definitely.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: So what's your novel about?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Well, it's a little difficult to summarize. It begins as a first-person account of a guy taking care of his father after a stroke. Kind of based on personal experience, but only loosely.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: What's the title?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: "The Day After Yesterday."

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Oh. You mean... today?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Um... yeah but it's more...

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: So is it kind of about death and mortality, or...?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Mrnmm, yeah... but not really. It shifts around a lot. Like you also start to see everything from the point of view of the father. And some other stuff happens, some parallel narrative, and then it evolves -- or devolves -- into a kind of a Robbe-Grillet mystery -- you know, with no real resolution.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Wow. Anyway, I think it's amazing you're getting it published. Really. I know how hard it is. Just to write it even.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yeah. Thanks.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Like me, I have this stupid paper due on Friday, and as usual I'm freaked out about it. Just like in high school. It never changes.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: A paper?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Yeah. I'm working on a masters in horticulture. Chipping away at it.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Horticulture? Wow. I didn't know there was a college here.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: I commute to San Luis Obispo twice a week.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: So... you want to work for a winery or something someday?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I do have a copy of the manuscript in the car. It's not fully proofed, but if you're okay with a few typos...

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Oh yeah. Who cares? I'm the queen of typos.  Wow, this is really starting to open up. What do you think?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: My palate's kind of shot, but from what I can tell, I'd dub it pretty damn good.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Can I ask you a personal question?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Why are you so into Pinot? It's like a thing with you.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I mean, Cabernets can be powerful and exalting, but they seem prosaic to me for some reason. By comparison. How about you?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: What about me?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I don't know. Why are you into wine?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: I suppose I got really into wine originally through my ex-husband. He had a big, kind of show-off cellar. But then I found out that I have a really sharp palate, and the more I drank, the more I liked what it made me think about.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yeah? Like what?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Like what a fraud he was.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Bathroom over there?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: You know how to get back to the Windmill, right?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Got it.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: I had a good time tonight, Miles. I really did.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Good. So did I.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Okay. See you around.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Um... did you still want to read my novel?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Oh, yeah. Sure. Of course.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Hope you like it. Feel free to stop reading at any time. I'll take no offense.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Goodnight, Miles.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Hey, Miles, I heard you came by the restaurant last night looking for me.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Oh, yeah. No. I mean yeah, I stopped by for a drink. Didn't see you.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: I had class.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Well, nice to see you now.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: You too.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: You guys should stop by the restaurant for lunch today.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Great. What's the latest we can get there?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: About two-thirty.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Did you hear about this Bordeaux tasting dinner down in Santa Barbara Saturday night? It's a little pricey, but if you wanted to go, I'd be into it. Why don't you stay through the weekend?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: No, we've got to get back Friday for the rehearsal dinner.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: What rehearsal dinner?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Were you ever going to say anything?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Of course I was. I mean, just now I could have made up some story, but I didn't. I told you the truth.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Maya.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Don't touch me. Just take me home.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I've told him. I've told him over and over, but he's out of control.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Do you know what he's been saying to her?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: He's an actor, so it can't be good.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Oh, just that he loves her. That she's the only woman who has ever really rocked his world. How he adores Siena. How he wants to move up here and get a place with the two of them and commute when he has to.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I'm sure he believed every word.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Please believe me. I was even on the verge of telling you last night, but...

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: But you wanted to fuck me first.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Oh, Maya. No.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: You know, I just spent three years trying to extricate myself from a relationship that turned out to be full of deception. And I've been doing just fine.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: And I haven't been with anyone since my divorce. This has been a big deal for me, Maya -- hanging out with you, and last night. I really like you, Maya. And I'm not Jack. I'm just his... his freshman roommate from San Diego State.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Hi. It's Maya. Please leave a message.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: It's Miles. Listen, I don't know if you even care, but I had to call and tell you again how much I enjoyed our time together and how sorry I am things turned out the way they did. I think you're great, Maya -- always have. From the first time you waited on me.  And while I'm at it, I guess you should know that my book is not getting published. I thought this one had a chance, but I was wrong. Again. Don't bother reading it -- you've got better things to do. So you see I'm not much of a writer. I'm not anything really. The only real talent I seem to have is for disappointing people and now you know that firsthand. We're leaving in the morning, and I want you to know that I take with me wonderful memories of you. I'm sorry. I'm really sorry.

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Victoria.

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Miles?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Victoria! How the hell are you?

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Fine. What's, uh, what's on your mind?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Heard you got remarried! Congratulations. Didn't think you had the stomach for another go-round.

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Oh, Miles. You're drunk.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Just some local Pinot, you know, then a little Burgundy. That old Cotes de Beaune!

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Where are you?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: A little place in Los Olivos. New owners. Cozy ambiance. Excellent food too -- you should try it. Thought of you at the Hitching Post last night.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Miles, don't call me when you're drunk.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I just wanted you to know I've decided not to go to the wedding, so in case you were dreading some uncomfortable, you know, run-in or something, well, worry no more. You won't see me there. My wedding gift to you and what's- his-name. What is his name?

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Ken.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Ken.

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Miles, I don't care if you come to the wedding or not.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Well, I'm not coming, Barbie. So you guys have fun.

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: I'm going to hang up now, Miles.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You see, Vicki, I just heard about this today, you getting married that is, and I was kind of taken aback. Kind of hard to believe.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I guess I just thought there was still some hope for us somewhere down the road and I just, I just --

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Miles, maybe it is better if you don't come to the wedding.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Hi, Vicki.  You look beautiful.

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Thanks. Um, this is Ken Cortland, my husband.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: That was big of him.

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Yeah, he's good that way. Very considerate.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: That's great.

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: So how're you doing?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Since the last time we spoke? I don't know. Could be better. Could be worse.

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: So what's happening with your book?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Universally rejected. Strike three.

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Oh, Miles. That's awful. What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Back to the drawing board, I guess. Or not. So... you're married. Congratulations. You look happy.

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: I am.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Seems like everyone's getting married. A year ago it was all divorces. Now it's all weddings. Cyclical, I guess.

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: I guess.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Well, let's go have some champagne, shall we? Toast all the newlyweds.

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Not me. I'm not drinking.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You quit drinking?

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: I'm pregnant.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Oh. Huh. Well...  Congratulations again, Vicki. That's wonderful news.

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: See you over there, Miles.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: How much skin and stem contact?

turns.speaker: POURER
turns.text: About four weeks.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Huh. That explains all the tannins. And how long in oak?

turns.speaker: POURER
turns.text: About a year.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: French or American?

turns.speaker: POURER
turns.text: Both.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Good stuff.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Pour me a full glass. I'll pay for it.

turns.speaker: POURER
turns.text: This is a tasting, sir. Not a bar.

turns.speaker: POURER
turns.text: Sir, what are you doing?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I told you I need a drink.

turns.speaker: POURER
turns.text: Then buy a bottle and go outside.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: So what do you think?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Quaffable but far from transcendent.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: Cabernet Franc.  This is only the fifth year we've made this varietal. Very few wineries around here do a straight Cabernet Franc. It's from our vineyard up in Santa Maria. And it was a Silver Medal winner at Paso Robles last year.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Well, I've come to never expect greatness from a Cab Franc, and this one's no exception. Sort of a flabby, overripe --

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: What's everyone ordering? Then we can sort out the wine.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Exactement!

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Should we get dessert?

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: We were thinking. Why don't we go back to my place? I've got wine, some insane cheeses, music, whatever.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: Anything but the Jayer Richebourg!

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: She has a Richebourg? Mon dieu. I have completely underestimated Stephanie.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: That was fun last night.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yeah. Good food. You've got quite a wine collection. Very impressive.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: Thanks. Hey, I talked to Maya this morning. She said she had a good time too. You should call her.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: Where's Jack?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: He had to make a phone call.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: So what are you up to today, Miles?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Just kickin' back, I guess. I don't know. Jack and I were supposed to go golfing.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: Huh.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yeah, I reserved the tee time about a month ago.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: Oops. Sorry.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You golf?

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: Me? No, I think it's kind of a stupid game. I mean, at least, I could never get into it. I tried it once.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Huh. Jack loves golf. Crazy about it.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: Hi, guys. We should probably get going.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: See you, Miles. You take care.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Bye, Stephanie. Bye, Siena, Caryl.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Stephanie! Stop!

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: You fucking bastard! Lying piece of shit! You're getting married on Saturday? What was all that shit you said to me?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: A famous actor who's getting married next week.

turns.speaker: PHYLLIS
turns.text: Oh, that's right. Isn't that nice? I hope that girls knows how lucky she is, marrying no less than Derek Summersby.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: It was a surprise, Mom.

turns.speaker: PHYLLIS
turns.text: And I could have already put clean sheets on the other bed and the fold- out. You are staying. Wendy, Ron and the twins are picking us up at 11:30 to go to brunch at the Sheraton. They do a magnificent job there. Wendy is so excited you're coming.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You talked to Wendy?

turns.speaker: PHYLLIS
turns.text: Just now. She's thrilled. And the kids.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yeah, well. You know, Jack's pretty eager to get up to... you know, but, uh, yeah. We'll see how it goes.

turns.speaker: PHYLLIS
turns.text: Well, you boys do what you want. I just think it would be nice for us to be together as a family on my birthday.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Uh-huh.  I'll be right back.

turns.speaker: PHYLLIS
turns.text: Miles, when are you going to get married again?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I just got divorced. Phyllis.

turns.speaker: BO
turns.text: Houdini's sick.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Please tie up Isabelle to the back of the shed. Make sure the knot's tight.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: BO
turns.text: I saw a monster. Can I have a glass of water?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: What's wrong with the water next to your bed?

turns.speaker: BO
turns.text: It tastes old.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: What's the rule about getting up in the middle of the night?

turns.speaker: BO
turns.text: Only for pee or poop.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: What are you thinking about?

turns.speaker: BO
turns.text: Why do you talk to mom when you're by yourself?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: It makes me feel better.

turns.speaker: BO
turns.text: Does she ever answer back?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BO
turns.text: She doesn't answer me either.

turns.speaker: BO
turns.text: There's dust in it.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: This one?

turns.speaker: BO
turns.text: A hair.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: This one?

turns.speaker: BO
turns.text: Morgan took a sip. It has his amoebas in it.
